page.title: 02Schools and the Community
page.content: In the 1980s schools have to play an active role in community life Birchwood schools all have joint_use facilities which provide accommodation for public use.St.Oliver Plunkett R.C. and Birchwood C.E. schools have parish rooms,Locking Stumps C.P.and Gorse Covert C.P.have community rooms, Chatfield C.P.has changing sports pitches and changing rooms.The High School has an excellent range of indoor and outdoor sports facilities as well as rooms in the school and library available for community use. Some facilities are only available out of school hours,others like the community rooms are available during the school day.Community rooms are mainly used for old peoples groups and playgroups.Schools can use these rooms but popular demand means that they are often fully booked.
